availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Lyter Giltner (Carroll County, KY, carpenter, sheriff, and prov govt conv rep)

body.p: Carroll County, Kentucky, carpenter and sheriff. Kentucky native. Son of Michael Giltner and Mary Giltner. Married to Martha G. Young Giltner in Carroll County on December 3, 1856. Father of Lela B. Giltner, William Henry Giltner, and Gideon Giltner. Carpenter in Carroll County in 1850. Sheriff in Carroll County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861. Served in the Fourth Regiment Cavalry Kentucky Volunteers (C.S.A.) as captain and colonel from September 10, 1862 to May 1, 1865.

ab.bibl:
